He said, 'Rabbi, we know you are from God because no one can do the amazing things you do unless God is with him.' A Rabbi is a teacher who helps people learn about God.

fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus asked Jesus, "How can someone be born again when they are already old? Can they go back into their mom's tummy to be born?" Jesus replied, "Listen carefully! No one can see God's Kingdom unless they start a new life with God. To start this new life, people must be baptized, which is like a special washing, and they also need to be born from God's Spirit. When we believe in Jesus, God's Spirit helps us change inside and trust Him to save us. This means we are starting fresh with God and can be close to Him forever!"

fresh_translation.text: When a baby is born, they come from their mom, which is a physical birth. But when someone believes in Jesus, they experience a special spiritual birth through God's Spirit. This new life means we can love others better and be part of God's family, learning about His love together!

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν οὐ κρίνεται, ὁ δὲ μὴ πιστεύων ἤδη κέκριται, ὅτι μὴ πεπίστευκεν εἰς τὸ ὄνομα τοῦ μονογενοῦς υἱοῦ τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden.
For God, who said, 'Let light shine out of darkness,' made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ.

translation_notes: In my revised translation, I need to maintain the essence of light versus darkness while ensuring it's easy for a seven-year-old to understand. I will explicitly reference Jesus as the light and include a mention of the idea of judgment and the connection to evil deeds to reflect the seriousness of the choices we make.

fresh_translation.text: Now listen closely: God sent Jesus to be the bright light that helps us see how to do good things. But some people don’t want to follow Jesus, so they stay in the dark. They love doing wrong things instead of what is right, and that keeps them away from God’s love and joy. This is a really important choice we all have to make because God loves us and wants us to be close to Him. Following Jesus, the light, is how we truly experience His love.

source: αὕτη δέ ἐστιν ἡ κρίσις, ὅτι τὸ φῶς ἐλήλυθεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον, καὶ ἠγάπησαν οἱ ἄνθρωποι μᾶλλον τὸ σκότος ἢ τὸ φῶς· ἦν γὰρ πονηρὰ αὐτῶν τὰ ἔργα.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
If we say we have fellowship with him while we walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth.
But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know over what they stumble.
Therefore be careful lest the light in you be darkness.

translation_notes: In this update, I need to incorporate the key concepts of sin, repentance, and God's desire for a relationship while ensuring that the language remains simple and relatable for a seven-year-old. I will also aim to clearly highlight the benefits of coming into God's light and the consequences of staying in the dark, enhancing the theological depth without losing clarity.

fresh_translation.text: Some people decide to do bad things, and they want to stay away from God's light because they are scared of being told they've done something wrong. But God’s light shows us how much He loves us and helps us make good choices. When we stay in the dark, we miss out on God's happiness and love. God really wants us to come into His light, say we're sorry for the wrong things we've done, and let Him help us do what is right. He loves us so much and is always ready to forgive us when we come back to Him.

source: πᾶς γὰρ ὁ φαῦλα πράσσων μισεῖ τὸ φῶς καὶ οὐκ ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα μὴ ἐλεγχθῇ τὰ ἔργα αὐτοῦ·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse is closely related to the previous one, as it contrasts the actions of those who do wrong with those who seek to do right. However, it can still stand alone with its meaning intact.

related_verses.text: Jesus spoke to them, saying, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life."
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.

translation_notes: To revise John 3:21, I will focus on simplifying the language while incorporating biblical terms that resonate with children. I will ensure the concepts of honesty, good deeds, and God's support are clearly communicated, aligning closely with the essence of the original text. I also aim to maintain the theological accuracy while keeping the overall message consistent with the preceding verse.

fresh_translation.text: But when people are honest and do what is true, they come into God's light. This shows everyone that their good deeds are done with God's help because they want to follow Him and make Him happy.

source: ὁ δὲ ποιῶν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα φανερωθῇ αὐτοῦ τὰ ἔργα, ὅτι ἐν Θεῷ ἐστιν εἰργασμένα.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in these verses flow well together, but they do not require rearranging or merging into one verse.

related_verses.text: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
And Peter said to them, "Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit."
Now Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John.
And Paul said, "John baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him, that is, Jesus."

translation_notes: I will revise the translation of John 3:22 to ensure clarity and conciseness for a seven-year-old, incorporating suggestions from my teachers. I will maintain the focus on Jesus' actions and teachings while simplifying the language. I will also ensure that it is relatable without straying too far from the original meaning.

fresh_translation.text: After that, Jesus and His friends went to Judea. There, Jesus taught people about loving God and each other. He baptized people to help them say sorry for bad things and to show they wanted to follow Him. This baptism was a way to show they believed in Jesus and wanted to live how God wants us to live.

source: Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβε μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
This water symbolizes baptism that now saves you also—not the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a clear conscience toward God.

translation_notes: I will incorporate the corrections given by my teachers to clarify John the Baptist's role, emphasize the significance of baptism, and enhance the connection to salvation through faith in Jesus while keeping the language suitable for a seven-year-old. I will also ensure the context from John 3:22 is respected and incorporated into the translation. The focus will be on making the message clear and relatable for young readers.

fresh_translation.text: At the same time, John the Baptist was in a place called Aenon, near Salim, where there was a lot of water. Many people came to John because they wanted to say they were sorry for the wrong things they did. They wanted to be friends with God again and get ready to follow Jesus. Baptism was a special way to show that they believed in Jesus and loved God. John was helping them make a promise to be part of God's family and to live the way God wants them to, just like Jesus was teaching everyone to do.

source: ἦν δὲ καὶ Ἰωάννης βαπτίζων ἐν Αἰνὼν ἐγγὺς τοῦ Σαλείμ, ὅτι ὕδατα πολλὰ ἦν ἐκεῖ, καὶ παρεγίνοντο καὶ ἐβαπτίζοντο·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse doesn't need to come before the previous one; it provides additional information about John the Baptist that follows logically after discussing his activities.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
So John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
I baptize with water, John replied, "but among you stands one you do not know.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."

translation_notes: I need to simplify the language while retaining the core message. I want to clarify that John the Baptist was free and emphasize his role as a messenger of God. I will also focus on making the concept of baptism clear without adding unnecessary details. It's important to ensure this fits smoothly with the previous verse's context.

fresh_translation.text: At that time, John the Baptist was still free and teaching people about God. Many came to him to be baptized because they wanted to say sorry for their wrong choices and start fresh with God. Baptism was a special sign that showed they loved God and wanted to follow Jesus. John was a messenger from God, helping everyone know how to follow Him.

source: οὔπω γὰρ ἦν βεβλημένος εἰς τὴν φυλακὴν ὁ Ἰωάννης.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse stands alone in context and does not require rearranging with the previous verse to maintain its meaning.

related_verses.text: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.

John answered them all, saying, 'I baptize you with water. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.'
I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me comes one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Paul said, 'John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.'
They came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan—the one you testified about—look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.'

translation_notes: I will adjust the translation to clarify key concepts like being 'right with God' instead of 'clean in God's eyes.' I'll focus on making the ideas of repentance and purification more explicit, ensuring the text is still simple and relatable for a seven-year-old. I will also incorporate a bit more about the discussion regarding purification while staying true to the essence of the original text.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John the Baptist's friends, called disciples, were talking with a Jewish man. They wanted to learn how to be right with God and make Him happy. They were curious about baptism, which is a way people show God they are truly sorry for their wrong choices and want to start fresh with Him. John the Baptist helped everyone understand that baptism is a special sign of love and an important step in following Jesus.

source: Ἐγένετο οὖν ζήτησις ἐκ τῶν μαθητῶν Ἰωάννου μετὰ Ἰουδαίου περὶ καθαρισμοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse does not need to be rearranged with the previous verse as it stands well on its own. However, it flows contextually from the previous conversation about baptism and followers of John.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."
When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened.

translation_notes: To create an updated translation of John 3:26 that maintains clarity for a seven-year-old while also addressing my teachers' corrections about John the Baptist's role and the divine identity of Jesus. I'll ensure the updated paraphrase reflects the context from the previous verse and emphasizes the relationship between John and Jesus without overwhelming the young audience with complexity.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John's friends came to him and said, "Teacher, do you remember the special man you talked about, Jesus? He's the Son of God! Now He is baptizing people, and many are going to Him. Baptism shows that people want to love God and start fresh, just like you taught them! It's so wonderful to see so many people wanting to follow Him!"

source: καὶ ἦλθον πρὸς τὸν Ἰωάννην καὶ εἶπον αὐτῷ· ῥαββί, ὃς ἦν μετὰ σοῦ πέραν τοῦ Ἰορδάνου, ᾧ σὺ μεμαρτύρηκας, ἴδε οὗτος βαπτίζει καὶ πάντες ἔρχονται πρὸς αὐτόν.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in this verse respond directly to the concerns raised in the previous verse, but they stand well on their own without needing to merge into a range. The concepts in JHN 3:27 clarify that everything we receive comes from God, which is a response but can be understood separately.

related_verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights.
Look at the birds of the air; they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
For who sees anything different in you? What do you have that you did not receive? If then you received it, why do you boast as if you did not receive it?
Nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything.
And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

translation_notes: I need to create a translation of John 3:27 that is simple enough for a seven-year-old to understand. It should convey that all good things come from God and emphasize the idea of divine sovereignty while keeping it relatable and engaging. I should integrate some of the suggestions from the teachers, such as mentioning the importance of God's permission and including a broader range of good things beyond just love and joy.

fresh_translation.text: John answered, "Nobody can have good things unless God lets them have it. Think of it like this: just like how you need someone to give you a present on your birthday, we need God to give us His good gifts. All the wonderful things like love, joy, peace, and wisdom come from God's heart, and they help us to know Him better!"

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰωάννης καὶ εἶπεν· οὐ δύναται ἄνθρωπος λαμβάνειν οὐδέν, ἐὰν μὴ ᾖ δεδομένον αὐτῷ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The message in this verse stands alone, as it clarifies John’s role without requiring additional context from the previous verse.

related_verses.text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, 'Who are you?'
This is he of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
This is he of whom it is written, 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
He said, 'I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the Lord,' as the prophet Isaiah said.
He must increase, but I must decrease.

translation_notes: I will simplify the language in John 3:28 to make it even more understandable for a seven-year-old. I will ensure to clarify John's role as a messenger sent by God and his humility in recognizing Jesus as the true Savior. The phrases about turning away from wrong actions will be made clearer by using simpler terms like 'bad things.' I will also make the connection between John's message and preparing for Jesus more explicit, keeping it aligned with the overall message of God's gifts from the previous verse.

fresh_translation.text: John the Baptist said, 'Remember how I told you that I am not the Christ, the one everyone is waiting for? I am like a helper who gets people ready to meet Him. God sent me to tell everyone to stop doing bad things and to get their hearts ready for Jesus, who is the true Savior.'

source: αὐτοὶ ὑμεῖς μοι μαρτυρεῖτε ὅτι εἶπον· οὐκ εἰμὶ ἐγὼ ὁ Χριστός, ἀλλ᾽ ὅτι ἀπεσταλμένος εἰμὶ ἔμπροσθεν ἐκείνου.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The meaning of this verse builds upon the previous one, emphasizing the joy of the friend of the bridegroom. However, it is not necessary to merge them into a single verse as they convey distinct thoughts that can stand alone while still being connected.

related_verses.text: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.
You all know that I told you, 'I am not the Christ.' I am just someone sent to tell you about Him.
Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
And I saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
And Jesus said to them, 'Can the wedding guests mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.'

translation_notes: In revising the translation of John 3:29, I will ensure that I maintain the friendly and joyful tone, while incorporating the feedback to clarify John the Baptist's role as the helper and the importance of Jesus being the awaited Savior. Additionally, I will simplify language further for a seven-year-old audience, addressing concerns about clarity without losing the essence of the original text. It's important to connect John's joy to the context provided in John 3:28.

fresh_translation.text: John said, 'Jesus is like a groom who loves his bride. I am a helper for the groom. When I hear the groom's voice, I feel really happy! My happiness is complete because I get to tell everyone about Jesus. He is the Savior that everyone has been waiting for.'

source: ὁ ἔχων τὴν νύμφην νυμφίος ἐστίν· ὁ δὲ φίλος τοῦ νυμφίου, ὁ ἑστηκὼς καὶ ἀκούων αὐτοῦ, χαρᾷ χαίρει διὰ τὴν φωνὴν τοῦ νυμφίου. αὕτη οὖν ἡ χαρὰ ἡ ἐμὴ πεπλήρωται.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The joy expressed in the previous verse builds up to the importance of the bridegroom's presence and role. However, JHN 3:30 stands alone as it reflects on the necessary growth of the bridegroom in contrast to the decrease of the friend. Thus, no merging is necessary, but understanding the relationship helps appreciate the context.

related_verses.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend who stands and listens to him is filled with joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. This joy of mine is now complete.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.
He must become greater; I must become less.
Then he said to them all: "Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me."

translation_notes: Incorporate the corrections regarding the necessity of Jesus' growth in importance, use more reverent language, and emphasize His divinity without losing the essence of joy and accessibility for a seven-year-old. Aim for clarity while maintaining respect for the original scripture.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus must be the most important person, and He needs to grow bigger and bigger! I feel really happy when I help everyone see how wonderful He is. It's like when I step back so Jesus can shine brighter; that brings me so much joy! I want everyone to see how amazing He is, and I'm excited to share the good news about Him as He becomes even more glorious.

source: ἐκεῖνον δεῖ αὐξάνειν, ἐμὲ δὲ ἐλαττοῦσθαι.

related_verses.text: They were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
He said to them, 'You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.'
For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.
No one has ascended into heaven except he who descended from heaven, the Son of Man.
The officers answered, 'No one ever spoke like this man!'
And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.

translation_notes: To enhance clarity and engage a seven-year-old's imagination, I will revise the translation to make the differences between earthly knowledge and divine knowledge more explicit. I'll also add some imagery and maintain a joyful tone throughout the paraphrase.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus is the one who came from heaven, and He is greater than anyone else! People here on earth can only talk about what they know, like sharing stories about their own lives, and sometimes they miss the big picture. But Jesus knows everything about God because He comes from heaven, where He sees everything clearly, like a superhero who can see far and wide! That’s why Jesus is better than everyone else! He has special knowledge and power that makes Him truly amazing.

source: ὁ ἄνωθεν ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστίν. ὁ ὢν ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐστι καὶ ἐκ τῆς γῆς λαλεῖ· ὁ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστί,

related_verses.text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.
No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.

Anyone who believes in the Son of God has this testimony in their heart. Anyone who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.
No one ever spoke the way this man does,” the guards replied.
Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus shares with us what He has seen and heard from God. His words are the truth and really special, so it's super important to believe in Him. But not everyone listens to Him, and some people decide not to believe what He says, even though He tells us what God wants us to know.

source: καὶ ὃ ἑώρακε καὶ ἤκουσε, τοῦτο μαρτυρεῖ, καὶ τὴν μαρτυρίαν αὐτοῦ οὐδεὶς λαμβάνει.

related_verses.text: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.

fresh_translation.text: When we believe what Jesus says, it shows that we trust God because He is always true. Jesus is God’s Son, and He speaks with authority about what God wants us to know. By believing in Jesus, we open our hearts to God's truth and build a close friendship with Him!

source: ὁ λαβὼν αὐτοῦ τὴν μαρτυρίαν ἐσφράγισεν ὅτι ὁ Θεὸς ἀληθής ἐστιν.

fresh_translation.text: God sent Jesus to share God’s words with us. Jesus tells us what God wants because the Holy Spirit is with Him. This shows that Jesus has God's special authority, and we can trust Him completely to share what God says.

source: ὃν γὰρ ἀπέστειλεν ὁ Θεός, τὰ ῥήματα τοῦ Θεοῦ λαλεῖ· οὐ γὰρ ἐκ μέτρου δίδωσιν ὁ Θεὸς τὸ Πνεῦμα.

I and the Father are one.
He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all—how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?
This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.
For you granted him authority over all people that he might give eternal life to all those you have given him.

fresh_translation.text: God loves Jesus, His Son, very much. He has given Jesus all power to help us. Jesus knows what God wants us to do because He shares God's message with us. Just like a great leader, He cares for us and guides us in the right way. We can trust Jesus completely to show us how to live because He is so close to God.

source: ὁ πατὴρ ἀγαπᾷ τὸν υἱὸν καὶ πάντα δέδωκεν ἐν τῇ χειρὶ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'

translation_notes: I need to revise the paraphrase of John 3:36 to address my teachers' feedback. I will focus on keeping the message clear and child-friendly while ensuring theological accuracy, especially concerning God's nature and the importance of belief versus disobedience. I want to use simple language suitable for a seven-year-old and ensure it aligns well with the preceding verse (John 3:35).

fresh_translation.text: If you believe in Jesus, you will have life forever with God. But if you don't believe in Him, you won't have that life. God loves everyone and wants them to choose to trust Him and be happy with Him, just like Jesus shows us how to live.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς τὸν υἱὸν ἔχει ζωὴν αἰώνιον· ὁ δὲ ἀπειθῶν τῷ υἱῷ οὐκ ὄψεται ζωήν, ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ὀργὴ τοῦ Θεοῦ μένει ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν.
